There have been various topics such as tests for the Infrastructure committee instance, creating the structure for maintaining multiple instances in the main devhub repository, support for multiple instances in the web4 social media landing pages and assistance in other tasks.", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "Below is a log of the time spent for various tasks. Troubleshooting \\\\\\\"VM is dead\\\\\\\" when running tests ( transaction popup not showing ) |\\\\n| 2024-05-22 | 1 | Top-level positioning | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/784](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/784) | Found that having an expression inside the styled.div breaks the VM ( leads to \\\\\\\"VM is dead\\\\\\\" ) and causes the transaction modal not to show, which is why the tests fail. Proposed to check for the gateway outside the styled.div expression |\\\\n| 2024-05-22 | 0,5 | Sync | | Weekly sync call |\\\\n| 2024-05-22 | 0,5 | Blog v2 search | [https://github.com/Tguntenaar/neardevhub-widgets/pull/6](https://github.com/Tguntenaar/neardevhub-widgets/pull/6) | Tiny fix for flaky category test |\\\\n| 2024-05-25 | 0,5 | Infrastructure committee Alpha Testing | | Created followup tickets for web4 short URLs: https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/issues/120 and https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/issues/121 |\\\\n| 2024-05-26 | 1 | RFP tests | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/775](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/775) | Edit RFP test, started work on Edit RFP test for \\\\\\\"Don\\\\\\'t ask again enabled\\\\\\\". Setup of cache configuration and wallet keys. ( [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/near-prpsls-bos/pull/12](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/near-prpsls-bos/pull/12) ) |\\\\n| 2024-05-27 | 3 | RFP tests | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/near-prpsls-bos/pull/12](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/near-prpsls-bos/pull/12) | Edit RFP with \\\\\\\"Don\\\\\\'t ask again\\\\\\\" enabled: wait for transaction result to finish mock new RFP content after transaction submit, check the viewed content after coming back to view mode. combination of multiple routes in playwright test using fallback. |\\\\n| 2024-05-28 | 1 | Maintenance of multiple instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/777](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/777) | Meeting with Megha and Thomas on refinement of plan for maintaining multiple instances of the DevHUB platform |\\\\n| 2024-05-29 | 0,5 | Notification when transaction fails | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/792](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/792) | Created issue |\\\\n| 2024-05-29 | 1 | Sync | | Weekly sync call, feedback on basic user experience (lagging, basic stuff not really working at all ) for comments on proposals, submitting and editing proposals, moderator stuff like editing timeline of proposals |\\\\n| 2024-05-29 | 2,5 | Comments for proposals | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/764](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/764) | Make tests work, by setting cache values for comments and also setting up dedicated event handler to clear editor content on transaction commit. |\\\\n| 2024-06-01 | 1 | Reviews | | Review of adding number format to amount field in Proposal ( [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/799#pullrequestreview-2092040276](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/799#pullrequestreview-2092040276) )

Including test implementations. |\\\\n| 2024-06-04 | 1 | Web4 landing for infrastructure/events committee | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/issues/127](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/issues/127) | Implemented replacement of references to devhub.near in web4_get to env::current_account_id(). See [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/128](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/128) |\\\\n| 2024-06-05 | 1 | Sync | | Weekly sync call with focus on Treasury Dashboard, and maintenance of multiple instances ( #777 ) |\\\\n| 2024-06-05 | 3 | Blogv2 migration | | Call with Thomas where we did the migration of the blogs. Needed to remove unwanted characters from blog post keys, and switch to near-api-js for sending the transactions. Added extra storage. Checked social db for all blogs to be transferred. [https://github.com/Tguntenaar/migrate-devhub-blogs](https://github.com/Tguntenaar/migrate-devhub-blogs) |\\\\n| 2024-06-08 | 2 | Maintenance of multiple instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/837](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/837) | Setup of BOS-workspace, but also identified the need for replacing aliases [https://github.com/NEARBuilders/bos-workspace/issues/109](https://github.com/NEARBuilders/bos-workspace/issues/109) |\\\\n| 2024-06-10 | 2 | Maintenance of multiple instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/838](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/838) | Merge of latest from main, point deployment pipeline to devhub instance directory, dry-run script, update to latest bos-workspace with the configurable alias prefix |\\\\n| 2024-06-11 | 1 | Maintenance of multiple instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/838](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/838) | Call with Megha and Thomas going through the changes, which are OK, but still the tests are using bos-loader and all replacements files, so this will have to be fixed before merge in order to avoid confusion with local dev using bos-workspace while tests are using bos-loader |\\\\n| 2024-06-11 | 2 | Maintenance of multiple instances | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/838](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/pull/838) | Remove old replacements files, old dev script, old build preview script. Changed docs to refer to new bos-workspace style of deploying preview, local development. Adjusted test gateway to trigger bos-loader directly and not via npm run dev. |\\\\n| 2024-06-12 | 1 | Sync | | Weekly sync and backlog grooming of Treasury dashboard |\\\\n| 2024-06-12 | 0,5 | Fix deployment | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/840](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-bos/issues/840) | Insert missing branch check for deployment pipeline |\\\\n| 2024-06-17 | 0,5 | Treasury Dashboard | | Assist in fetching data for balance chart, and also initial dashboard visibility test |\\\\n| 2024-06-19 | 0,5 | Treasury Dashboard | | Call with Megha going through how to fetch balance data by resolving the block hashes of each receipt in a transaction to determine which block heights to query the account balance on after a transaction. |\\\\n| 2024-06-20 | 0,5 | Sync | | |\\\\n| 2024-06-20 | 2 | Landing title and description from socialdb | [https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/134](https://github.com/NEAR-DevHub/neardevhub-contract/pull/134) | Fetch description and title for web4 landing page from socialdb profile metadata |\\\\n| | | | |\\\\n\\\\nTotal hours: 37.5\\\\nHourly rate (USD): $150\\\\nTotal requested amount (USD): 5625", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "petersalomonsen.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5625", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

{"handle": "developer-dao", "community": {"tag": "developer-dao", "name": "Developer DAO", "addons": [{"id": "announcements", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "announcements", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Announcements"}, {"id": "discussions", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "discussions", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Discussions"}, {"id": "activity", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "activity", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Activity"}, {"id": "glzdo0", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "telegram", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"handles\\\\\\\":[\\\\\\\"NEARDevHub\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"neardev\\\\\\\"]}", "display_name": "Telegram"}, {"id": "akf4hz", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"## What is the NEAR Developer DAO?\\\\\\\\nDeveloper DAO (DevDAO) brings together individuals and organizations to build a decentralized NEAR developer ecosystem. We provide social structures and tools to empower anyone to ideate, implement, review, and support projects in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Mission\\\\\\\\nBuild a growing self-sufficient community of NEAR developers to enable a thriving NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Values\\\\\\\\n- **Decentralized:** We are building together.\\\\\\\\n- **Transparent:** All decision making and communication is open.\\\\\\\\n- **Self-sufficient:** We do not critically depend on any single entity.\\\\\\\\n- **Robust:** Any role or team can be duplicated or replaced.\\\\\\\\n- **High-velocity:** We need to move faster than classic OSS.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Vision\\\\\\\\nWe are building an open source developer community on NEAR that owns all aspects of its own success, including coding, event organization, promotion, fundraising, partnerships, etc. DevDAO establishes and maintains the structure and the processes to grow our developer ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Example areas of involvement include:\\\\\\\\n- **Technical decision making:** Partnering with recognized experts to review technical proposals and making decisions based on the needs of the community and ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n- **Creating deep tech awareness:** Working with marketing partners to create awareness on interesting projects and technology areas.\\\\\\\\n- **Organizing events and local presence:** Organizing events and empowering community leaders with resources to grow their local communities.\\\\\\\\n- **Managing documentation and public repositories:** Managing a variety of documentation and public repositories that support NEAR developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Roles & Responsibilities\\\\\\\\nDevDAO provides various social structures to support developers:\\\\\\\\n- **Work Groups:** A formal committee of selected subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions in their ecosystem focus area. Each work group has the authority to review proposals using a strict process, suggest funding to a DAO, and hold grant recipients accountable. They also engage with the community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. As of April 2023, we have six Work Groups with more underway. There is also a Moderators Work Group that supervises and facilitates other Work Groups.\\\\\\\\n- **Community Groups:** An informal self-organized group of people interested in a specific topic area. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to connect with others to share ideas and submit proposals. Each group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. We have about 15 Community Groups as of April 2023.\\\\\\\\n- **DevDAO Operations:** A minimal group of operators managing the legal and the administrative side of DevDAO.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Sponsorships\\\\\\\\nOur goal is to grow an ecosystem of developers who are here because they like the technology and community. Given that there\\\\u{2019}s a lot of time and effort that goes into this, we have financial means to compensate for some activities and projects for the involvement areas above. Our budget comes from our [staking pool](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/devgov-dao-staking-pool-announcement), the NEAR Foundation, as well as other partners in the ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWe use the [NEAR Dev Hub](https://neardevhub.org/) as our main platform for sponsoring projects and individual contributions to the NEAR developer ecosystem. The Funding Board shows all the projects that we approved for funding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you are interested in applying for funding from DevDAO, check out our funding guidelines.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Overview"}, {"id": "2te4j0", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"How to get help\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Welcome to DevHub! We are a community project and everyone is invited to participate and contribute. If you find something missing or have an idea, don\\\\u{2019}t hesitate to create it. We welcome active engagement and collaboration. Here\\\\u{2019}s a guide on how to get started.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# What are you looking for?\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4a1}I have an idea or discussion topic\\\\\\\\n- Share your ideas on [DevHub](https://neardevhub.org)\\\\\\\\n - **Browse**: Before posting your idea, search for other previous discussions to learn from previous efforts.\\\\\\\\n - **Share**: Create an [idea post](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/how-to-ideate-in-the-near-developer-governance) with clear information: Describe the problem, desired outcome, and call to action. \\\\\\\\n - **Amplify**: Gather support and validation from the relevant community groups and experts.\\\\\\\\n - **Engage**: Monitor replies and follow up with people who commented.\\\\\\\\n- Explore ideas using [Community Groups](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.communities)\\\\\\\\n - **Search Groups**: Browse community groups to connect with like-minded individuals in specific topic areas.\\\\\\\\n - **Get Involved**: Join groups, introduce yourself, and learn about recent activities.\\\\\\\\n - **Participate**: Engage in discussions or propose new ideas.\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f494} Something is broken\\\\\\\\n**Is it a DevHub supported area?**\\\\\\\\n- **Platform**: neardevhub.org\\\\\\\\n- **Repo:** NEPs \\\\\\\\n- **Developer Tools**: near-api-js, near-sdk-rs, near-sdk-js, near-cli-rs, near-cli (JS), workspaces-rs, workspaces-js, create-near-app and their family of project starter [boilerplate-template-js, boilerplate-template-keypom, boilerplate-template-ipfs, boilerplate-template-rs, near-sdk-js-template-project], ABI family [Any repos under https://github.com/near/ with \\\\u{201c}ABI\\\\u{201d} or \\\\u{201c}abi\\\\u{201d} in project name]\\\\\\\\n- **Documentation and examples**: docs.near.org, github.com/near-examples/, any examples under github.com/near/ (we\\\\u{2019}ll migrate them to near-examples soon), wiki.near.org, thewiki.near.page, github.com/near/docs-generator\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2705} IF YES: Check if we\\\\u{2019}re already aware of it by checking issues in corresponding github repo. File an issue with more details if we\\\\u{2019}re not aware or comment on the existing issue that describes your problem to escalate. If you have additional questions, check out the README or website to find out how to reach the maintainer. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f6ab} IF NO: Please continue.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Is it a [Pagoda](https://www.pagoda.co) supported area?**\\\\\\\\n- nearcore\\\\\\\\n- node-docs, indexer-docs\\\\\\\\n- pagoda-docs\\\\\\\\n- near-microindexers\\\\\\\\n- near-lake-framework-js\\\\\\\\n- near-lake-framework-rs\\\\\\\\n- near-enhanced-api-server\\\\\\\\n- near-explorer\\\\\\\\n- near-indexer-for-explorer\\\\\\\\n- nearup\\\\\\\\n- near-laker-indexer\\\\\\\\n- near-analytics\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2705} IF YES: Submit a new issue or comment on an existing issue on the corresponding repo. If you have additional questions, check out the README or website to find out how to reach the maintainer. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f6ab} IF NO: Please continue.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Is it a community supported repo?**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2705} IF YES: Check out the repo\\\\u{2019}s README or website to find out how to reach the community maintainer. Community repos have different level of support and way of reporting and responding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{1f6ab} IF NO: It\\\\u{2019}s possibly a deprecated repo. If unsure, you can contact us via [#neardev](https://t.me/neardev) to confirm.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{2692}\\\\u{fe0f} I want to help fix a known issue\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. Find out the issue in one of the DevHub supported repos (listed in previous section).\\\\\\\\n2. Comment to indicate you\\\\u{2019}re interested to work on it.\\\\\\\\n3. Make a pull request and related project owner will review your PR and contact you.\\\\\\\\n4. If the review goes well, your work will be merged and you helped us resolve an issue!\\\\\\\\n5. If you want to contribute to a repo on a regular basis, reach out to DevHub Team by writing a post on DevHub, with the label \\\\u{201c}paid-contributors\\\\u{201d}. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n--- \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4b0} I need funding from DevHub\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCheck out our general [funding guidelines](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines). For event specific funding, check out the DevHub Hacks Community [guidelines](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.wiki?handle=hacks&id=2).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n--- \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f5e3}\\\\u{fe0f} I want to stay in touch\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Staying Connected with DevHub:**\\\\\\\\n- Join our Telegram channels: [NEARDevHub](https://t.me/NEARDevHub) and [NEARDev](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\\\\\n- Subscribe to [NEARWEEK newsletter](https://subscribe.nearweek.com/)\\\\\\\\n- Follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub)\\\\\\\\n- Subscribe to our [YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARDevHub)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n--- \\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f469}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} I want to propose a technical enhancement to the ecosystem\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have an idea that you want to integrate across the NAER ecosystem, consider working on a [NEAR enhancement proposal](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Do you still need help?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f5e3}\\\\u{fe0f} Public Discussions\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nPublic discussions promote transparency, learning, and inclusivity. We encourage you to engage in open dialogue on NEAR DevHub or other community channels. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4e7} Email Us\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have legal or security concerns, you can reach out to devhub at near.org. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4ac} Direct Telegram Message (Last Resort)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWhile we encourage public discussions, we understand that some concerns may require private communication. As a last resort, you can message any core DeveloperDAO member on Telegram for assistance and we\\\\u{2019}ll help you identify the right place.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Get Support"}, {"id": "n2vw8s", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "blog", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Blog"}, {"id": "1mcnhy", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO Funding Guidelines\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"*Updated March 22, 2024*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWelcome! If you have a project that improves the NEAR developer experience, DevDAO may be able to provide funding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## About DevDAO\\\\\\\\nDevDAO is the primary organization behind DevHub. Our mission is to build a thriving, self-sufficient NEAR developer community by focusing on developer onboarding and engagement.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Areas of Funding\\\\\\\\nWe support initiatives that make it easier for developers to get started with NEAR, engage with the community, and contribute successfully. Example areas:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevTools**: SDKs, CLIs, IDEs, and documentation (Rust and JS stacks) that streamline development.\\\\\\\\n* **DevRel**: Activities that onboard and engage developers including tutorials, guides, onboarding experiences, community support channels, and IRL/online events.\\\\\\\\n* **DevHub Portal**: Creating essential tools for managing proposals, treasury, and community collaboration.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Evaluation Criteria\\\\\\\\nWe want to fund projects that positively impact the NEAR developer journey. Here\\\\\\'s what we look for:\\\\\\\\n* **Developer First**: We strongly support proposals that prioritize the needs of developers and help growth and retain the number of active developers on NEAR. Show us how your solution will make it easy for developers to succeed, whether through tools, libraries, education, or other initiatives.\\\\\\\\n* **Open Source**: Not all proposals require code, but they should follow the spirit of knowledge sharing and collaboration.\\\\\\\\n* **Public Good**: We want to see clear benefits to the NEAR & broader community.\\\\\\\\n* **Execution Ability**: Demonstrate your ability to to deliver by sharing your team\\\\u{2019}s track record of success and available resources.\\\\\\\\n* **Clear Use of Funds**: We expect to carefully consider the factors that influence your funding amount request and present clearly how the funding will enable your goals.\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n## Funding Journey\\\\\\\\nThe funding of projects is a collaborative and transparent effort between the applicant, various Work Groups in the NEAR developer community, and the DevDAO Moderators. It involves the key stages below.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nThe proposal life cycle begins when an author submits a draft. During the draft stage, the proposal is open for community comments and the author can still make changes and build consensus.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Get Started**: To submit a draft, navigate to the [/proposals](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposals) feed page and click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"New Proposal.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" It is a good idea to browse other proposals to learn from previous efforts and consider how your proposal differs from or builds upon existing ideas. \\\\\\\\n* **Fill Out Your Draft**: Complete these required fields:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Category: Select the category that best aligns with your project or contribution.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Title: Craft a concise and descriptive title that captures the essence of your proposal in a few words. This will appear on your proposal\\\\u{2019}s detail page and the main proposal feed. Keep it short, please. (e.g., \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Streamlined Onboarding Tutorials for New NEAR Developers\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Summary: Briefly explain your proposal\\\\\\'s goals and the benefits it brings to the NEAR developer community. (Consider using a problem-solution approach: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Problem: New developers struggle to find clear onboarding resources. Solution: We propose creating interactive tutorials...\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Description: Expand on your summary with details like your contribution timeline, key milestones, team background, and a clear breakdown of how the funds will be used. Keep the description simple and easy to understand. Proposals should be simple and clear (e.g. 1 month). For more complex projects, treat each milestone as a separate proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Other Fields: Complete all other remaining fields, including KYC/KYB Verification, funding amount, currency preference, NEAR wallet address, requested sponsor, and consent to the Terms & Conditions and Code of Conduct.\\\\\\\\n* **Submit or Continue Editing**: Click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Draft\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to post the draft to the community, or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for review\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to start the official review process with DevDAO. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in draft mode. To edit the proposal, click Edit.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Move to Review**: Once you\\\\\\'re ready for DevDAO to review your proposal, change the status to \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for Review.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" This moves your proposal to the review stage and locks the editing function, but comments are still open. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in Review mode. At this point, DevDAO may consider reviewing your proposal. DevHub Community Managers review submitted proposals on a weekly cadence and request from the appropriate Work Groups or DevHub moderators to review. \\\\\\\\n* **Community Input**: Your proposal is open for discussion. Engage with the community, consider suggestions, and make any necessary adjustments based on feedback. \\\\\\\\n* **Sponsor Review**: DevDAO Moderators review submitted proposals on a regular cadence and may consult relevant working groups for input.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNote: If you wish to cancel your proposal, you can click Cancel Proposal. This changes the status to Canceled, signaling to DevDAO that it\\\\u{2019}s no longer active or relevant.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevDAO Evaluation** DevDAO Moderators consider community feedback, available budget, alignment with focus areas, and various other factors to make a collaborative decision. Once the DevDAO Moderators update the decision, they will add a comment to the sponsorship to indicate the decision & next steps. \\\\\\\\n* **Possible Decisions**: Approved, Approved (Conditional), Rejected, Canceled (by the author).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 4: Payment Processing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **KYC/KYB Verification**: If the proposal is approved, DevDAO Moderators will move the proposal to the Payment Processing stage and first verify that you have already completed KYC/KYB verification to ensure legal compliance.\\\\\\\\n* **Information Collection & Legal Steps (with NEAR Foundation)**: Once verified, DevDAO moderators will request for you to complete the following required steps with the NEAR Foundation:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t1. Complete the Funding Request using the Airtable form.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t2. Sign the agreement after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation legal team using Ironclad.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t3. Submit the final invoice after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation finance team using Request Finance.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t4. Confirm the test transaction after receiving a test transaction confirmation email from the NEAR Foundation finance team. \\\\\\\\n* **Payment Disbursement**: Typically, funds are disbursed within 10 business days, but timelines may vary.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\n* **Transparency**: Once funded, payment details are made public on the proposal page.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Need More Help?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have further questions, please post a comment on the [DevHub Platform](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devhub-platform&tab=discussions) community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Funding"}, {"id": "p6oi6p", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "kanban", "parameters": {"addons": [{"id": "announcements", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "announcements", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Announcements"}, {"id": "discussions", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "discussions", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Discussions"}, {"id": "activity", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "activity", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Activity"}, {"id": "glzdo0", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "telegram", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"handles\\\\\\\":[\\\\\\\"NEARDevHub\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"neardev\\\\\\\"]}", "display_name": "Telegram"}, {"id": "akf4hz", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"About\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"## What is the NEAR Developer DAO?\\\\\\\\nDeveloper DAO (DevDAO) brings together individuals and organizations to build a decentralized NEAR developer ecosystem. We provide social structures and tools to empower anyone to ideate, implement, review, and support projects in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Mission\\\\\\\\nBuild a growing self-sufficient community of NEAR developers to enable a thriving NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Values\\\\\\\\n- **Decentralized:** We are building together.\\\\\\\\n- **Transparent:** All decision making and communication is open.\\\\\\\\n- **Self-sufficient:** We do not critically depend on any single entity.\\\\\\\\n- **Robust:** Any role or team can be duplicated or replaced.\\\\\\\\n- **High-velocity:** We need to move faster than classic OSS.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Vision\\\\\\\\nWe are building an open source developer community on NEAR that owns all aspects of its own success, including coding, event organization, promotion, fundraising, partnerships, etc. DevDAO establishes and maintains the structure and the processes to grow our developer ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Example areas of involvement include:\\\\\\\\n- **Technical decision making:** Partnering with recognized experts to review technical proposals and making decisions based on the needs of the community and ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n- **Creating deep tech awareness:** Working with marketing partners to create awareness on interesting projects and technology areas.\\\\\\\\n- **Organizing events and local presence:** Organizing events and empowering community leaders with resources to grow their local communities.\\\\\\\\n- **Managing documentation and public repositories:** Managing a variety of documentation and public repositories that support NEAR developers.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Roles & Responsibilities\\\\\\\\nDevDAO provides various social structures to support developers:\\\\\\\\n- **Work Groups:** A formal committee of selected subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions in their ecosystem focus area. Each work group has the authority to review proposals using a strict process, suggest funding to a DAO, and hold grant recipients accountable. They also engage with the community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. As of April 2023, we have six Work Groups with more underway. There is also a Moderators Work Group that supervises and facilitates other Work Groups.\\\\\\\\n- **Community Groups:** An informal self-organized group of people interested in a specific topic area. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to connect with others to share ideas and submit proposals. Each group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. We have about 15 Community Groups as of April 2023.\\\\\\\\n- **DevDAO Operations:** A minimal group of operators managing the legal and the administrative side of DevDAO.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Sponsorships\\\\\\\\nOur goal is to grow an ecosystem of developers who are here because they like the technology and community. Given that there\\\\u{2019}s a lot of time and effort that goes into this, we have financial means to compensate for some activities and projects for the involvement areas above. Our budget comes from our [staking pool](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/devgov-dao-staking-pool-announcement), the NEAR Foundation, as well as other partners in the ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWe use the [NEAR Dev Hub](https://neardevhub.org/) as our main platform for sponsoring projects and individual contributions to the NEAR developer ecosystem. The Funding Board shows all the projects that we approved for funding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you are interested in applying for funding from DevDAO, check out our funding guidelines.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Overview"}, {"id": "2te4j0", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"How to get help\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Welcome to DevHub! We are a community project and everyone is invited to participate and contribute. If you find something missing or have an idea, don\\\\u{2019}t hesitate to create it. We welcome active engagement and collaboration. Here\\\\u{2019}s a guide on how to get started.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# What are you looking for?\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4a1}I have an idea or discussion topic\\\\\\\\n- Share your ideas on [DevHub](https://neardevhub.org)\\\\\\\\n - **Browse**: Before posting your idea, search for other previous discussions to learn from previous efforts.\\\\\\\\n - **Share**: Create an [idea post](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/how-to-ideate-in-the-near-developer-governance) with clear information: Describe the problem, desired outcome, and call to action. \\\\\\\\n - **Amplify**: Gather support and validation from the relevant community groups and experts.\\\\\\\\n - **Engage**: Monitor replies and follow up with people who commented.\\\\\\\\n- Explore ideas using [Community Groups](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.communities)\\\\\\\\n - **Search Groups**: Browse community groups to connect with like-minded individuals in specific topic areas.\\\\\\\\n - **Get Involved**: Join groups, introduce yourself, and learn about recent activities.\\\\\\\\n - **Participate**: Engage in discussions or propose new ideas.\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f494} Something is broken\\\\\\\\n**Is it a DevHub supported area?**\\\\\\\\n- **Platform**: neardevhub.org\\\\\\\\n- **Repo:** NEPs \\\\\\\\n- **Developer Tools**: near-api-js, near-sdk-rs, near-sdk-js, near-cli-rs, near-cli (JS), workspaces-rs, workspaces-js, create-near-app and their family of project starter [boilerplate-template-js, boilerplate-template-keypom, boilerplate-template-ipfs, boilerplate-template-rs, near-sdk-js-template-project], ABI family [Any repos under https://github.com/near/ with \\\\u{201c}ABI\\\\u{201d} or \\\\u{201c}abi\\\\u{201d} in project name]\\\\\\\\n- **Documentation and examples**: docs.near.org, github.com/near-examples/, any examples under github.com/near/ (we\\\\u{2019}ll migrate them to near-examples soon), wiki.near.org, thewiki.near.page, github.com/near/docs-generator\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2705} IF YES: Check if we\\\\u{2019}re already aware of it by checking issues in corresponding github repo. File an issue with more details if we\\\\u{2019}re not aware or comment on the existing issue that describes your problem to escalate. If you have additional questions, check out the README or website to find out how to reach the maintainer. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f6ab} IF NO: Please continue.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Is it a [Pagoda](https://www.pagoda.co) supported area?**\\\\\\\\n- nearcore\\\\\\\\n- node-docs, indexer-docs\\\\\\\\n- pagoda-docs\\\\\\\\n- near-microindexers\\\\\\\\n- near-lake-framework-js\\\\\\\\n- near-lake-framework-rs\\\\\\\\n- near-enhanced-api-server\\\\\\\\n- near-explorer\\\\\\\\n- near-indexer-for-explorer\\\\\\\\n- nearup\\\\\\\\n- near-laker-indexer\\\\\\\\n- near-analytics\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2705} IF YES: Submit a new issue or comment on an existing issue on the corresponding repo. If you have additional questions, check out the README or website to find out how to reach the maintainer. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n \\\\u{1f6ab} IF NO: Please continue.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Is it a community supported repo?**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2705} IF YES: Check out the repo\\\\u{2019}s README or website to find out how to reach the community maintainer. Community repos have different level of support and way of reporting and responding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{1f6ab} IF NO: It\\\\u{2019}s possibly a deprecated repo. If unsure, you can contact us via [#neardev](https://t.me/neardev) to confirm.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{2692}\\\\u{fe0f} I want to help fix a known issue\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n1. Find out the issue in one of the DevHub supported repos (listed in previous section).\\\\\\\\n2. Comment to indicate you\\\\u{2019}re interested to work on it.\\\\\\\\n3. Make a pull request and related project owner will review your PR and contact you.\\\\\\\\n4. If the review goes well, your work will be merged and you helped us resolve an issue!\\\\\\\\n5. If you want to contribute to a repo on a regular basis, reach out to DevHub Team by writing a post on DevHub, with the label \\\\u{201c}paid-contributors\\\\u{201d}. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n--- \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4b0} I need funding from DevHub\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nCheck out our general [funding guidelines](https://www.neardevgov.org/blog/near-developer-governance-funding-guidelines). For event specific funding, check out the DevHub Hacks Community [guidelines](https://near.social/devgovgigs.near/widget/gigs-board.pages.community.wiki?handle=hacks&id=2).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n--- \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f5e3}\\\\u{fe0f} I want to stay in touch\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Staying Connected with DevHub:**\\\\\\\\n- Join our Telegram channels: [NEARDevHub](https://t.me/NEARDevHub) and [NEARDev](https://t.me/neardev)\\\\\\\\n- Subscribe to [NEARWEEK newsletter](https://subscribe.nearweek.com/)\\\\\\\\n- Follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub)\\\\\\\\n- Subscribe to our [YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/@NEARDevHub)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n--- \\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f469}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{1f4bb} I want to propose a technical enhancement to the ecosystem\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have an idea that you want to integrate across the NAER ecosystem, consider working on a [NEAR enhancement proposal](https://github.com/near/NEPs/blob/master/neps/nep-0001.md).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n---\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n# Do you still need help?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f5e3}\\\\u{fe0f} Public Discussions\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nPublic discussions promote transparency, learning, and inclusivity. We encourage you to engage in open dialogue on NEAR DevHub or other community channels. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4e7} Email Us\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have legal or security concerns, you can reach out to devhub at near.org. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## \\\\u{1f4ac} Direct Telegram Message (Last Resort)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWhile we encourage public discussions, we understand that some concerns may require private communication. As a last resort, you can message any core DeveloperDAO member on Telegram for assistance and we\\\\u{2019}ll help you identify the right place.\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Get Support"}, {"id": "n2vw8s", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "blog", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Blog"}, {"id": "blogv2", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "blogv2", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "BlogV2"}, {"id": "1mcnhy", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO Funding Guidelines\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"*Updated March 22, 2024*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWelcome! If you have a project that improves the NEAR developer experience, DevDAO may be able to provide funding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## About DevDAO\\\\\\\\nDevDAO is the primary organization behind DevHub. Our mission is to build a thriving, self-sufficient NEAR developer community by focusing on developer onboarding and engagement.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Areas of Funding\\\\\\\\nWe support initiatives that make it easier for developers to get started with NEAR, engage with the community, and contribute successfully. Example areas:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevTools**: SDKs, CLIs, IDEs, and documentation (Rust and JS stacks) that streamline development.\\\\\\\\n* **DevRel**: Activities that onboard and engage developers including tutorials, guides, onboarding experiences, community support channels, and IRL/online events.\\\\\\\\n* **DevHub Portal**: Creating essential tools for managing proposals, treasury, and community collaboration.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Evaluation Criteria\\\\\\\\nWe want to fund projects that positively impact the NEAR developer journey. Here\\\\\\'s what we look for:\\\\\\\\n* **Developer First**: We strongly support proposals that prioritize the needs of developers and help growth and retain the number of active developers on NEAR. Show us how your solution will make it easy for developers to succeed, whether through tools, libraries, education, or other initiatives.\\\\\\\\n* **Open Source**: Not all proposals require code, but they should follow the spirit of knowledge sharing and collaboration.\\\\\\\\n* **Public Good**: We want to see clear benefits to the NEAR & broader community.\\\\\\\\n* **Execution Ability**: Demonstrate your ability to to deliver by sharing your team\\\\u{2019}s track record of success and available resources.\\\\\\\\n* **Clear Use of Funds**: We expect to carefully consider the factors that influence your funding amount request and present clearly how the funding will enable your goals.\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n## Funding Journey\\\\\\\\nThe funding of projects is a collaborative and transparent effort between the applicant, various Work Groups in the NEAR developer community, and the DevDAO Moderators. It involves the key stages below.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nThe proposal life cycle begins when an author submits a draft. During the draft stage, the proposal is open for community comments and the author can still make changes and build consensus.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Get Started**: To submit a draft, navigate to the [/proposals](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposals) feed page and click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"New Proposal.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" It is a good idea to browse other proposals to learn from previous efforts and consider how your proposal differs from or builds upon existing ideas. \\\\\\\\n* **Fill Out Your Draft**: Complete these required fields:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Category: Select the category that best aligns with your project or contribution.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Title: Craft a concise and descriptive title that captures the essence of your proposal in a few words. This will appear on your proposal\\\\u{2019}s detail page and the main proposal feed. Keep it short, please. (e.g., \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Streamlined Onboarding Tutorials for New NEAR Developers\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Summary: Briefly explain your proposal\\\\\\'s goals and the benefits it brings to the NEAR developer community. (Consider using a problem-solution approach: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Problem: New developers struggle to find clear onboarding resources. Solution: We propose creating interactive tutorials...\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Description: Expand on your summary with details like your contribution timeline, key milestones, team background, and a clear breakdown of how the funds will be used. Keep the description simple and easy to understand. Proposals should be simple and clear (e.g. 1 month). For more complex projects, treat each milestone as a separate proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Other Fields: Complete all other remaining fields, including KYC/KYB Verification, funding amount, currency preference, NEAR wallet address, requested sponsor, and consent to the Terms & Conditions and Code of Conduct.\\\\\\\\n* **Submit or Continue Editing**: Click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Draft\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to post the draft to the community, or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for review\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to start the official review process with DevDAO. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in draft mode. To edit the proposal, click Edit.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Move to Review**: Once you\\\\\\'re ready for DevDAO to review your proposal, change the status to \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for Review.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" This moves your proposal to the review stage and locks the editing function, but comments are still open. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in Review mode. At this point, DevDAO may consider reviewing your proposal. DevHub Community Managers review submitted proposals on a weekly cadence and request from the appropriate Work Groups or DevHub moderators to review. \\\\\\\\n* **Community Input**: Your proposal is open for discussion. Engage with the community, consider suggestions, and make any necessary adjustments based on feedback. \\\\\\\\n* **Sponsor Review**: DevDAO Moderators review submitted proposals on a regular cadence and may consult relevant working groups for input.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNote: If you wish to cancel your proposal, you can click Cancel Proposal. This changes the status to Canceled, signaling to DevDAO that it\\\\u{2019}s no longer active or relevant.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevDAO Evaluation** DevDAO Moderators consider community feedback, available budget, alignment with focus areas, and various other factors to make a collaborative decision. Once the DevDAO Moderators update the decision, they will add a comment to the sponsorship to indicate the decision & next steps. \\\\\\\\n* **Possible Decisions**: Approved, Approved (Conditional), Rejected, Canceled (by the author).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 4: Payment Processing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **KYC/KYB Verification**: If the proposal is approved, DevDAO Moderators will move the proposal to the Payment Processing stage and first verify that you have already completed KYC/KYB verification to ensure legal compliance.\\\\\\\\n* **Information Collection & Legal Steps (with NEAR Foundation)**: Once verified, DevDAO moderators will request for you to complete the following required steps with the NEAR Foundation:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t1. Complete the Funding Request using the Airtable form.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t2. Sign the agreement after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation legal team using Ironclad.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t3. Submit the final invoice after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation finance team using Request Finance.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t4. Confirm the test transaction after receiving a test transaction confirmation email from the NEAR Foundation finance team. \\\\\\\\n* **Payment Disbursement**: Typically, funds are disbursed within 10 business days, but timelines may vary.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\n* **Transparency**: Once funded, payment details are made public on the proposal page.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Need More Help?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have further questions, please post a comment on the [DevHub Platform](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devhub-platform&tab=discussions) community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Funding"}, {"id": "p6oi6p", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "kanban", "parameters": {"data": {"blog": {"near-bounty-booster-3286": {"": "### Hey developers \\\\u{1f44b}!\\\\n  \\\\nWelcome to **NEAR\\\\\\'s Bounty Booster Program**. If you participate in any hackathon and choose to build on NEAR, you\\\\\\'ll have the chance to earn additional rewards!! We\\\\\\'ll boost your winning prize with additional rewards, giving you the support you need to keep building. So, don\\\\\\'t miss out on this incredible opportunity to showcase your skills. \\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n#### 1. How It Works \\\\u{1f929} : \\\\nParticipate in any hackathon NEAR is not sponsoring, submit a project utilizing the NEAR stack, and if you win...get ready for a bounty boost! We\\\\\\'ll match a percentage of your prize money, up to $5,000 per team. \\\\n\\\\n`EXAMPLE`: if your team wins a $2,000 prize at a hackathon and the NEAR DevHub team determines a match percentage of 50% for your submission, NEAR will boost your winnings with an additional $1000!!!\\\\n\\\\nIt\\\\\\'s that simple! Any developer anywhere in the world can benefit from the support and resources provided by **NEAR DevHub** if they choose to build on the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n#### 2. Application Process \\\\u{270d}\\\\u{fe0f} :\\\\n\\\\n- Submit your project to a **non-NEAR-sponsored hackathon**.\\\\n\\\\n- Your project must utilize tools provided by NEAR, including **Chain Abstraction, React-on-Chain, Smart Contracts in Rust (Rust, JS, AssemblyScript), SDK, and other related tools**.\\\\n\\\\n- Tweet about your submission, mentioning the hackathon, @NEARDevHub, and using hashtags: `#NEARBountyBooster, #extralife, #NEARDevHub, and #NEAR.`\\\\n\\\\n- Complete the NEAR Bounty Booster application \\\\u{1f449} [form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfmVN4n_A0mduNVjF4PAlhllr7nQo4Xjlsei1fcA5Wvruqo2A/viewform?usp=sf_link) with project details.\\\\n\\\\n- You can submit multiple applications, but each project must be distinct.\\\\n\\\\n- Use this [sample tweet](https://typefully.com/t/bHCRD5z) as a guide.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n#### 3. Verification and Payment \\\\u{2705} :\\\\n- The NEAR Bounty Booster committee will verify the eligibility of the hacker team and their winning project based on the information provided in the application form and the tweet.\\\\n\\\\n- Once verified, the matched bounty amount will be paid to the hacker team within 30 days of the application submission.\\\\n  \\\\n\\\\n***Please pay attention to the terms and conditions below***\\\\n  \\\\n#### Terms & Conditions \\\\u{1f468}\\\\u{1f3fc}\\\\u{200d}\\\\u{2696}\\\\u{fe0f} : \\\\n- The exact percentage matched is determined by the NEAR DevHub team on a case-by-case basis, ensuring the program can adapt to the unique circumstances of each project and developer.\\\\n\\\\n- Each project must be distinct from the ones previously submitted for the Bounty Booster program.\\\\n\\\\n- To be considered to have \\\\\\\"won\\\\\\\" a prize, the hacker team must have been awarded one of the general prizes or sponsor-specific bounties offered by the hackathon organizers..\\\\n\\\\n- The NEAR Bounty Booster committee reserves the right to reject any application if there is an attempt to abuse the program.\\\\n\\\\n- By participating in the NEAR Bounty Booster program, hacker teams agree to these terms and conditions. The NEAR Bounty Booster committee reserves the right to modify these terms and conditions without prior notice.\\\\n\\\\n  \\\\n##### Happy Building!\\\\n", "metadata": {"title": "NEAR Bounty Booster ", "author": "victorkanu1.near", "status": "PUBLISH", "category": "guide", "subtitle": "", "updatedAt": "2024-06-21", "description": "", "publishedAt": "2024-04-23"}}}}, "handle": "developer-dao"}

{"data": {"blog": {"devhub-streamlines-funding-3251": {"": "We\\\\\\'re excited to announce a major upgrade to DevHub that transforms the funding journey! After collaborating with hundreds of community contributors and organizations, we\\\\u{2019}ve completely revamped the proposal submission and funding process. This makes it easier to submit, review, and approve proposals aligned with DevDAO\\\\u{2019}s mission of fostering a thriving NEAR developer community.\\\\n\\\\nExplore the new experience on the [Proposal Feed](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposals).\\\\n\\\\n## What\\\\u{2019}s new?\\\\n* **A Clear Journey:** Our new structured proposal format and dedicated feed make it easy to understand requirements and submit proposals to DevDAO.\\\\n* **Enhanced Transparency:** Track progress and understand the rationale behind funding decisions with clear updates and timelines.\\\\n* **KYC/KYB Integration:** Verification with Fractal helps establish the identity of recipients, prompting trust and compliance.\\\\n* **Focused Collaboration:** Better tools for all participants to actively discuss, comment, and collaborate within each proposal.\\\\n* **Decentralized & Transparent Decisions:** Community involvement and clear rationale guide funding choices, fostering trust in the process.\\\\n\\\\n## Pilot Program with DevDAO\\\\nFor the initial launch, the new proposal experience offers a clear and organized way to submit and manage funding requests specifically from DevDAO, the main entity behind DevHub. We focus on funding projects that drive developer growth:\\\\n\\\\n* **DevTools**: SDKs, CLIs, IDEs, and documentation (Rust and JS stacks) that streamline development.\\\\n* **DevRel**: Activities that onboard and engage developers including tutorials, guides, onboarding experiences, community support channels, and IRL/online events.\\\\n* **DevHub Portal**: Building essential tools for managing proposals, treasury, and community collaboration.\\\\n\\\\n## Get Involved\\\\nThe DevHub Portal is a vibrant hub where diverse communities connect, collaborate, and find resources for building on NEAR. The new proposal experience streamlines a key aspect \\\\u{2013} funding for developer-centric projects.\\\\n\\\\n* **Have a proposal?** Head over to the [Proposal Feed](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposals).\\\\n* **Need guidance?** Review our detailed [funding guidelines](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao&tab=funding).\\\\n* **Want to connect?** Catch the latest announcements and join the discussions in our various [communities](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=communities).\\\\n\\\\n## What About the Old Activity Feed?\\\\nDon\\\\\\'t worry, the conversations from the old activity feed are still archived [here](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=feed)!\\\\n\\\\n## What\\\\u{2019}s next?\\\\nThis pilot phase with DevDAO focuses on streamlining the funding process, laying the groundwork for a model that can empower other organizations within the NEAR ecosystem. We\\\\u{2019}re working on further automating the process and creating tools for efficient decision-making and treasury management. Your feedback is crucial. Let us know how we can improve by contributing to the discussions in the [DevHub Portal](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devhub-platform&tab=discussions) community.\\\\n", "metadata": {"title": "DevHub Streamlines Funding", "author": "theori.near", "status": "PUBLISH", "category": "news", "subtitle": "Introducing the New Proposal Experience for DevDAO", "updatedAt": "2024-06-21", "description": "Introducing the New Proposal Experience for DevDAO", "publishedAt": "2024-03-21"}}}}, "handle": "developer-dao"}
